dataset_info.description: Comprehensive dataset for testing AI models on environmental and technical data extraction using path-based references

documents.title: HP Laptop Environmental Sheet
documents.text:
HP EliteBook 840 G9 Environmental Data

Product Information:
- Model: HP EliteBook 840 G9
- SKU: 6F6K8EA
- Weight: 1.36 kg

Carbon Footprint Analysis:
- Total carbon footprint: 285 kg CO₂ equivalent
- Manufacturing phase: 215 kg CO₂
- Transportation: 15 kg CO₂
- Use phase (4 years): 55 kg CO₂

Energy Specifications:
- Typical power consumption: 45W
- Sleep mode: 2.1W
- Annual energy consumption: 65 kWh

Certifications:
- ENERGY STAR 8.0 certified
- EPEAT Gold registered
- RoHS compliant

questions.question: What is the total carbon footprint of this laptop?
Break down the carbon footprint by lifecycle phases

documents.title: Dell Monitor Technical Specifications
documents.text:
Dell UltraSharp U2723QE 27" 4K Monitor
Environmental & Performance Specifications

=== POWER CONSUMPTION TABLE ===
| Mode          | Power (W) | Annual kWh | Cost/Year* |
|---------------|-----------|------------|------------|
| On (100%)     | 32.0      | 117.3      | $14.08     |
| On (75%)      | 28.5      | 104.5      | $12.54     |
| On (50%)      | 24.1      | 88.4       | $10.61     |
| Standby       | 0.3       | 2.6        | $0.31      |
| Off           | 0.1       | 0.9        | $0.11      |
*Based on $0.12/kWh, 10h/day usage

=== ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT ===
Carbon Footprint Assessment:
→ Manufacturing: 156 kg CO₂eq
→ Packaging: 12 kg CO₂eq  
→ Distribution: 8 kg CO₂eq
→ Use phase (5 years): 89 kg CO₂eq
→ End-of-life: -5 kg CO₂eq (recycling credit)
→ TOTAL LIFECYCLE: 260 kg CO₂eq

Recyclability:
• Monitor components: 78% by weight
• Packaging materials: 95% recyclable
• Plastic content: 25% post-consumer recycled

Compliance & Certifications:
✓ ENERGY STAR 8.0
✓ EPEAT Gold
✓ TCO Certified 9.0
✓ RoHS, WEEE, REACH compliant

documents.text:
INVOICE #INV-2024-5847
TechCorp Solutions Ltd.
Date: March 15, 2024

=== ORDER DETAILS ===
Dell PowerEdge R750 Server Configuration
Part No: R750-CONFIG-001
Quantity: 2 units

COST BREAKDOWN:
┌─────────────────────────┬─────────────┬─────────────┐
│ Component               │ Unit Price  │ Total       │
├─────────────────────────┼─────────────┼─────────────┤
│ Base Server (2U)        │ $3,299.00   │ $6,598.00   │
│ Intel Xeon Gold 6338    │ $1,850.00   │ $3,700.00   │
│ 128GB DDR4 ECC RAM      │ $945.00     │ $1,890.00   │
│ 2TB NVMe SSD Storage    │ $489.00     │ $978.00     │
│ Redundant PSU (800W)    │ $275.00     │ $550.00     │
│ 3-Year ProSupport       │ $699.00     │ $1,398.00   │
├─────────────────────────┼─────────────┼─────────────┤
│ Subtotal                │             │ $15,114.00  │
│ Tax (8.5%)              │             │ $1,284.69   │
│ Carbon Offset Fee       │             │ $67.50      │
│ TOTAL                   │             │ $16,466.19  │
└─────────────────────────┴─────────────┴─────────────┘

CARBON IMPACT INFORMATION:
• Estimated carbon footprint per server: 1,350 kg CO₂
• Carbon offset purchased: 2,700 kg CO₂ total
• Offset cost: $0.025/kg CO₂
• Servers qualify for 15% energy efficiency tax credit
• Expected operational carbon: 890 kg CO₂/year per server

PAYMENT TERMS:
Net 30 days
Payment method: Wire transfer
Currency: USD

documents.title: Smartphone Lifecycle Assessment Report
documents.text:
COMPREHENSIVE LIFECYCLE ASSESSMENT
Apple iPhone 14 Pro Environmental Report
Study Period: 2023-2024 | Assessment Scope: Cradle-to-Grave

=== EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ===
The iPhone 14 Pro demonstrates a 23% reduction in carbon intensity compared to the iPhone 13 Pro, primarily due to manufacturing process improvements and increased use of recycled materials.

=== DETAILED CARBON ANALYSIS ===

RAW MATERIALS & MANUFACTURING (72% of total impact):
┌──────────────────────┬──────────┬────────────┬─────────────┐
│ Component Category   │ Weight   │ CO₂ (kg)   │ % of Total  │
├──────────────────────┼──────────┼────────────┼─────────────┤
│ A16 Bionic Chip      │ 15.2g    │ 18.4       │ 26.3%       │
│ Display Assembly     │ 42.8g    │ 12.7       │ 18.1%       │
│ Battery (Li-ion)     │ 47.9g    │ 8.9        │ 12.7%       │
│ Aluminum Frame       │ 89.1g    │ 6.2        │ 8.9%        │
│ Camera System        │ 28.5g    │ 5.8        │ 8.3%        │
│ Other Components     │ 34.8g    │ 4.3        │ 6.1%        │
│ Packaging           │ 185.2g   │ 2.1        │ 3.0%        │
├──────────────────────┼──────────┼────────────┼─────────────┤
│ SUBTOTAL            │ 443.5g   │ 58.4       │ 83.4%       │
└──────────────────────┴──────────┴────────────┴─────────────┘

TRANSPORTATION & DISTRIBUTION (8% of total impact):
• Air freight (factories → distribution): 4.2 kg CO₂
• Ground transport (regional distribution): 1.4 kg CO₂
• Last-mile delivery: 0.6 kg CO₂
• SUBTOTAL: 6.2 kg CO₂

USE PHASE (15% of total impact) - Based on 3-year lifecycle:
• Daily charging (average 1.2 cycles): 0.025 kWh/day
• Annual electricity consumption: 9.1 kWh
• Grid carbon intensity (global average): 0.519 kg CO₂/kWh
• 3-year use phase total: 14.2 kg CO₂

END-OF-LIFE PROCESSING (5% of total impact):
• Material recovery potential: 89% by value
• Recycling energy requirements: 2.8 kg CO₂
• Landfill avoidance credit: -1.2 kg CO₂
• NET END-OF-LIFE: 1.6 kg CO₂

=== TOTAL LIFECYCLE IMPACT ===
🌍 TOTAL CARBON FOOTPRINT: 80.4 kg CO₂ equivalent

=== SUSTAINABLE MATERIALS BREAKDOWN ===
• Recycled rare earth elements in magnets: 100%
• Recycled tungsten in Taptic Engine: 100%
• Recycled aluminum in enclosure: 100%
• Recycled gold in wire bonding: 100%
• Recycled plastic in components: 35%
• Overall recycled content by weight: 43%

=== COMPARISON WITH PREVIOUS GENERATION ===
Carbon footprint improvement vs iPhone 13 Pro:
→ 2022 iPhone 13 Pro: 104.8 kg CO₂
→ 2023 iPhone 14 Pro: 80.4 kg CO₂
→ Absolute reduction: 24.4 kg CO₂ (-23.3%)
→ Main improvement drivers:
  * Manufacturing efficiency: -15.2 kg CO₂
  * Increased recycled materials: -6.8 kg CO₂
  * Supply chain optimization: -2.4 kg CO₂

documents.title: Data Center Carbon Optimization Study
documents.text:
COMPREHENSIVE DATA CENTER CARBON OPTIMIZATION ANALYSIS
Facility: CloudTech West Coast Data Center
Study Period: Q1 2024 | Baseline vs Optimized Configuration

=== INFRASTRUCTURE OVERVIEW ===
Total IT Load: 2.4 MW (2,400 kW)
Total Facility Load: 3.6 MW (including cooling, lighting, UPS losses)
Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE): 1.50 (baseline) → 1.28 (optimized)

=== ENERGY CONSUMPTION ANALYSIS ===

BASELINE CONFIGURATION (Q4 2023):
┌────────────────────────┬─────────────┬──────────────┬─────────────┐
│ Component Category     │ Power (kW)  │ Annual MWh   │ % of Total  │
├────────────────────────┼─────────────┼──────────────┼─────────────┤
│ Servers (Active)       │ 1,680       │ 14,717       │ 46.7%       │
│ Servers (Idle)         │ 420         │ 3,679        │ 11.7%       │
│ Storage Systems        │ 180         │ 1,577        │ 5.0%        │
│ Network Equipment      │ 120         │ 1,051        │ 3.3%        │
│ Cooling (CRAC units)   │ 900         │ 7,884        │ 25.0%       │
│ UPS & Power Dist.      │ 180         │ 1,577        │ 5.0%        │
│ Lighting & Misc.       │ 120         │ 1,051        │ 3.3%        │
├────────────────────────┼─────────────┼──────────────┼─────────────┤
│ TOTAL FACILITY         │ 3,600       │ 31,536       │ 100.0%      │
└────────────────────────┴─────────────┴──────────────┴─────────────┘

OPTIMIZED CONFIGURATION (Q1 2024):
• Server consolidation (virtualization): -15% server count
• Dynamic power management: -25% idle power
• Upgraded cooling system (hot aisle containment): -30% cooling power
• LED lighting conversion: -60% lighting power
• New UPS efficiency (96% vs 94%): -10% UPS losses

=== CARBON IMPACT CALCULATIONS ===

Grid Carbon Intensity (California):
• Off-peak (23:00-06:00): 0.198 kg CO₂/kWh (35% renewable)
• Mid-peak (06:00-16:00): 0.267 kg CO₂/kWh (28% renewable)
• On-peak (16:00-23:00): 0.384 kg CO₂/kWh (18% renewable)
• Weighted average: 0.289 kg CO₂/kWh

ANNUAL CARBON EMISSIONS:

Baseline (2023): 31,536 MWh × 0.289 kg/kWh = 9,114 metric tons CO₂

Optimized (2024):
• Servers: (1,680 × 0.85 + 420 × 0.75) × 8,760h = 15,466 MWh
• Cooling: 900 × 0.70 × 8,760h = 5,519 MWh
• UPS: 180 × 0.90 × 8,760h = 1,419 MWh
• Lighting: 120 × 0.40 × 8,760h = 421 MWh
• Other unchanged: (180 + 120) × 8,760h = 2,628 MWh
• Total optimized: 25,453 MWh
• Carbon emissions: 25,453 × 0.289 = 7,356 metric tons CO₂

CARBON REDUCTION ACHIEVED:
→ Absolute reduction: 9,114 - 7,356 = 1,758 metric tons CO₂/year
→ Percentage reduction: 19.3%
→ Equivalent to removing 382 passenger cars from roads

=== FINANCIAL ANALYSIS ===
Electricity cost (blended rate): $0.145/kWh

Baseline annual cost: 31,536 MWh × $145/MWh = $4,572,720
Optimized annual cost: 25,453 MWh × $145/MWh = $3,690,685
Annual savings: $882,035

Optimization investment: $2,800,000
Payback period: 3.2 years
ROI over 10 years: 215%

=== FUTURE PROJECTIONS ===
With planned solar installation (2025):
• 15 MW solar array (capacity factor: 28%)
• Annual generation: 36,792 MWh
• Projected grid independence: 85%
• Additional carbon reduction: 5,247 metric tons CO₂/year
• Total carbon reduction vs 2023 baseline: 75.6%
